TextEncoder.summary: The TextEncoder interface enables you to character encoding a JavaScript string using UTF-8.

TextEncoderEncode.summary: The TextEncoder.encode() method takes a string as input, and returns a containing the string {{glossary("character encoding", "encoded")}} using {{glossary("UTF-8")}}.
TextEncoderEncode.returns: A object containing the UTF-8 encoding of the input string.

TextEncoderEncodeInto.summary:
The TextEncoder.encodeInto() method takes a string to encode and a destination to put resulting {{glossary("UTF-8")}} encoded text into, and returns an object indicating the progress of the encoding.
This is potentially more performant than the method â€” especially when the target buffer is a view into a Wasm heap.
TextEncoderEncodeInto.returns: An object, which contains two members:

TextEncoderEncoding.summary: The TextEncoder.encoding read-only property returns a string containing the name of the encoding algorithm used by the specific encoder.

remarks.para: It always has the value utf-8.

TextEncoderEncoding.value: A string with the value utf-8.

TextEncoderTextEncoder.summary: The TextEncoder() constructor returns a newly created object.
